sen.j: 官年（かんねん）とは、近世武家社会において幕府や主家などの公儀に対し届けられた公式な年齢をいう。
sen.e: In modern samurai society, kannen was the official age of a person reported in official eve the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or the ruling family.
In modern samurai society, kannen was the official age of a person reported to the authorities such as the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or the family of lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: in official eveの訳が不完全でした。「幕府や主家などの公儀」の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: In modern samurai society, kannen was the official age of a person reported to the authorities such as the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or the family of lord of the domain.

sen.j: 家督相続や出仕、お目見得などに関わる年齢制約を回避するために年齢を操作して届出るこのような慣行が成立した。
sen.e: This custom was created to bypass age restrictions set on family successions, entering government service, and gaining an audience with the shogun.
This custom of manipulating a person's age to report was created to bypass age restrictions set on family successions, entering government service, and gaining an audience with the shogun.
sen.cmt: 「年齢を操作して届出る」の訳が欠けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: This custom of manipulating a person's age to report was created to bypass age restrictions set on family successions, entering government service, and gaining an audience with the shogun.

sen.j: これに対し実際の年齢は生年といった。
sen.e: The actual age of a person was called seinen.

sen.j: 幕府法制では17歳未満の武家は養子を迎えることができず、17歳未満の当主が、危篤状態もしくは急死したとしても急養子を迎えられず家が断絶してしまう可能性があった。
sen.e: By Bakufu law, those born in a samurai family under the age of 17 could not adopt a child; when a family head was under 17, and had critical illness or died unexpectedly, the family faced the possibility of ending with his line without an heir.

By Bakufu law, a samurai family with the head under the age of 17 could not adopt a child, so if the young head of the family had critical illness or died unexpectedly, the family faced the possibility of ending its line without an heir.
sen.cmt: 前半をわかりやすく修正しました。
sen.e: By Bakufu law, a samurai family with the head under the age of 17 could not adopt a child, so if the young head of the family had critical illness or died unexpectedly, the family faced the possibility of ending its line without an heir.

sen.j: このため、家督を継承する可能性がある男子に対しては予め年齢を嵩上げする形で年齢操作が行われた。
sen.e: Therefore, boys in line to inherit their family estate had a few yeas added to their actual age.
Therefore, the age of a boy in line to inherit his family estate was reported as a few years older than his actual age.
sen.cmt: 「実際の年齢よりも年嵩にして届けた」と解釈しました。
sen.e: Therefore, the age of a boy in line to inherit his family estate was reported as a few years older than his actual age.

sen.j: この時代は乳幼児の死亡率が極めて高かったため、子供が生まれたとしても即座に公儀へ届け出る必要は必ずしもなかった。
sen.e: In this time period, the death rate of infants was considerably high; therefore, when a child was born, it was not required to report the birth immediately to the shogunate.
In this time period, the death rate of infants was considerably high; therefore, when a child was born, it was not required to report the birth immediately to the authorities.
sen.cmt: 上記と同様、公儀には主家も含まれるようなのでauthoritiesとしました。
sen.e: In this time period, the death rate of infants was considerably high; therefore, when a child was born, it was not required to report the birth immediately to the authorities.

sen.j: 出生直後に届出を行わなかった場合は、子供が十分に成育した段階になってからはじめて「病弱であったので今まで遠慮していましたが随分丈夫になりましたので」という形で、出生届けである丈夫届を公儀に提出した。
sen.e: If a child was not registered immediately after birth, the family could do so after the child has grown under the pretext that the child was too ill, which made them hesitant to register him.

If a child was not registered immediately after birth, his family could report his birth after he had grown up by submitting a Jobu todoke (notice of good health) in place of the birth registration under the pretext of being hesitant to register him because of his poor health in his childhood.
sen.cmt: 丈夫届について訳文に含まれていなかったので修正しました。
sen.e: If a child was not registered immediately after birth, his family could report his birth after he had grown up by submitting a Jobu todoke (notice of good health) in place of the birth registration under the pretext of being hesitant to register him because of his poor health in his childhood.

sen.j: このように実際の出生時期と出生届の提出時期が離れているため数年単位での年齢操作が可能であった。
sen.e: In this way, as there was always a gap between the time of actual birth and the time of birth registration, it was possible to manipulate the child's age by a few years.

sen.e: After an audience with a young samurai, the shogun remarked, "What is his seinen? He seems still a child."

sen.j: 老中が将軍家子女の縁組に関連して相手先の大名家に縁組候補の若君の生年を照会した
sen.e: When the roju (shogun's council of elders) arranged a marriage for the shogun family, they revealed the young man's seinen to the other party.

When a roju (shogun's council of elders) was arranging a marriage for a daughter of the shogun family, he inquired the prospective bridegroom's seinen of the daimyo family from which the young man came from.
